title: Number of cigarettes smoked daily in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2015
summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
The lowest value at Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 is 12.0x times less than the highest value at 6 to 10.
min_summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Number of cigarettes, and Share of respondents in each Number of cigarettes on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 and lowest at Number of cigarettes 31 to 50.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
The lowest value at Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 is 12.0x times less than the highest value at 6 to 10.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Number of cigarettes 1 to 5.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Number of cigarettes is 22.0.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 is higher than any other Number of cigarettess with value 24.0, followed by 1 to 5, and 11 to 15. Down to Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 with the lowest value 2.0.
The Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has 1.86 times more Share of respondents than average.
The Share of respondents is 103.0 if we add up values of all Number of cigarettess.
